results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Senior Account Manager (Covering Welsh Region)

Who are you?

We are looking for an ambitious Account Manager to drive account growth and work closely with our client wing to deliver a best-in-class service each and every time!

Key responsibilities

  • Actively manage sales cycle for existing accounts; analyse and present data to your clients on a quarterly basis and support your clients with needs-based business cases.
  • Achieve and maintain high levels of satisfaction among senior stakeholder’s client side, achieving target scores from identified stakeholders.
  • Full contract management including renewals, change notices, risk mitigation and escalation, as well as involvement within bids and tenders
  • Provide internal forecasting reports on key customer commercial metrics
  • Understand what really matters to your stakeholders and the client, present benefits and value delivered to the Trust internally at Board and review meetings and via external comms
  • Work closely with sales and marketing team to generate leads into other Trusts, ICS, STP, and align strongly with our infamous transformation team to ensure we can deliver!

 

OK, that’s me, but who are DrDoctor?

DrDoctor is a HealthTech company on an exciting growth trajectory. Our technology focuses on engaging patients across their healthcare journey while saving hospitals time, effort, and money.

Our Mission is that healthcare needs a reset. More people need care every day and health services struggle. Current patient engagement is a mess of disparate systems that hinder, rather than help care delivery.

Our Vision is a remote-first healthcare system, which can meet demand without sacrificing care quality. We want patients to be engaged in their care, shifting to a digital first model.

We do this at scale:

  • 17 million+ patients use DrDoctor
  • We manage over 70 million appointments
  • We work with over 44 NHS Trusts and Health Boards (and still growing!)

We :green_heart: the NHS and want to help it work better. We radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and taxpayers.

OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?

  • Demonstrable experience working with the NHS, ideally in a digital capacity.
  • Experience working as an Account Manager/Success Manager, focusing on account optimisation and upsell, with a track record in change management, project delivery or meeting sales targets
  • You know how to adapt your style to varying levels of people within the NHS
  • Have the ability to simplify a complex set of problems and structure the right solution for our clients - this may include project planning, technical understanding, benefits analysis etc.
  • You excel in a high growth, fast-paced, agile environment, and love getting the work done right
  • You are passionate about our mission 

We know from research and experience that candidates may not apply if they don’t think they meet 100% of our requirements. If you don’t tick all the boxes but feel you would be a good fit, we would still love to hear from you. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture!

Just to let you know too, we will need you to have the Right To Work in the UK, and as we work closely with the NHS, if we get to the stage where we make you an offer to join us, we will also need to undertake a DBS check.

We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CVs to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual reply if it’s not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. It’s just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue, then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Some our roles will also be subject to completing an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

I can’t wait to get started, what are the perks?

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

  • Remote by default approach - Everyone at DrDoctor will work remotely most of the time with regular opportunities to socialise and engage at office spaces available in London and Manchester.
  • Flexible working (we understand we all have family and personal commitments; you can work where you are at your best and at times when you are most productive)
  • Part time working considered - let us know what you need and we’ll do our best to find the right balance for both parties
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays (with our own extra DrDoctor Bank Holidays thrown in for good measure!)
  • 4 duvet days per year for those days that you just don’t fancy working
  • Personal development time every other Friday, or for a whole day per month, differing based on which team you’re in
  • Mental health support through our partner OpenUp and our own in-house Mental Health First Aiders
  • Drinks/other fun things sent to you in the post
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • A new office space in Southwark including a Multipurpose quiet room which can be used for activities such as Prayer, Meditation, or caring for your baby
  • Enhanced parental leave (up to 16 weeks fully paid parental leave for anyone who brings a child into their home – whether this is via birth, adoption or surrogacy)
  • Salary competitive and dependant on experience, we benchmark our salaries to accurately reflect the market at least once a year, and we benchmark all of our roles (regardless of where in the UK you live) based on London salaries.
  • A focus on your career progression based on our progression framework, regular 6 months' pay reviews and mentoring opportunities
  • EMI share options scheme!

As DrDoctor has grown, we are seeing more of our people wanting to socialise in different ways.

Whilst we know that some of us love to go to the pub, we want to make sure we are including a wide variety of activities and events for our teams to enjoy each other's company, we aim to continue creating an open space for anyone and everyone to suggest how they’d like to spend time with their teams.

We love a Summer and Christmas party and regular company/team socials and away days. So far in 2022, we have enjoyed picnics at a nearby farm, a water colouring session, board games evening and Crystal Maze! We have also held various events for celebrations such as Eid ul-Fitr, Holi Festival, International Women’s Day and our 10 year anniversary!

Salary banding for this role is: £55,000 - £70,000 + Commission

results.title: QA engineer (Python)
results.description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

EXANTE is a wealthtech company that provides centralised trading solutions and B2B financial infrastructure that helps create value through technology.

Our proprietary trading platform enables direct market access to a wide range of financial instruments including stocks, ETFs, bonds, futures, options and more from a single multi-currency account.

With over 600 employees and a decade in the market, EXANTE’s presence extends across over 10 locations, including but not limited to the UK, Cyprus, Malta and Hong Kong.

We're growing 70% year-on-year and hiring globally day-by-day. Learn more about the EXANTE corporate culture and company benefits: https://careers.exante.eu/about/

 

THE ROLE

QA engineer with experience in both manual and automated backend testing

Python + pytest

Ability to work in bash and with SQL also

Experience with JSON, XML

 

Key resposibilities:

- functional and exploratory testing of services, and preparing them for release;

- formalization of the test base in TMS (Qase);

- establishment of bug reports (Jira);

- development and updating of a complex of autotests (in the future)

- participation in projects where earlier testing was carried out without QA engineers.

Requirements

- General experience in QA from 3 years;

- test analysis and test design skills;

- programming language: Python (PyTest, Requests libraries);

- experience in analyzing server logs;

- level of English, allowing to read technical documentation;

- knowledge in the field of exchange trading or clearing (if you have this experience, please indicate in the cover letter);

- desire to learn and learn new things;

 

The advantage will be:

- Experience with Postman, Selenium, Json and xml modification

- Experience with GitLab CI

Benefits

  • Flexible work schedule for optimal work-life balance;
  • Ability to work completely remotely;
  • Relocation (we pay a bonus, help from the company);
  • Vacation 28 calendar days / paid sick leave;
  • VHI policy and co-financing program for training after passing the probationary period;
  • A working laptop;
  • International experience
  • Minimum bureaucracy and the ability to move to other teams.

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Do you innovate with integrity? Believe a team is stronger together? Are you passionate about sustainability? If these are some of the attributes that describe you, then read on. We are looking for courageous, collaborative, and curious problem solvers who are interested in joining our team to help us develop solutions to complex challenges.

Digimarc is a global leader in product digitization, delivering business value across industries through unique identities and cloud-based solutions. A trusted partner in deterring counterfeiting of global currency for more than 20 years, Digimarc uncovers a product's journey to provide intelligence and promote a prosperous, safer, and more sustainable world. With Digimarc, you can finally see everything. And when you see everything, you can achieve anything. For more information, visit us at digimarc.com.

 

THE CHALLENGE…

Join our mission to digitize everything! We're seeking an ambitious account executive with a hunter mentality to focus on finding new business prospects and help them envision and digitized future where anything is possible. Bring your creative side to consult with key decision makers, identify their business goals, and develop engaging proposals for our watermarking technology which demonstrate the value of customer insights and experiences with their brand. In this role, you’ll have the flexibility of working remotely within our RevTeam and be responsible for fully understanding a client’s needs and determining whether we can meet those needs. This is a newly created role with the goal of increasing our sales velocity reporting to our VP, of Product Sales.

 

WHAT YOU WILL DO…

As a direct sales Account Executive, you will focus on new account development and/or expanding existing accounts within an established geographic territory or product line selling products or services directly to the end user. Additionally, you’ll work with clients to cultivate future projects and qualify for new opportunities.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of SaaS sales experience as a quota-carrying individual contributor
  • Strong outbound prospecting skills; confident in cold calling, and use of SalesLoft a plus
  • Track record of attaining quota
  • Ability to accurately forecast deals within a quarter, ideally by month
  • Consultative sales approach to uncover business objectives and position solutions
  • Resourceful; ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams
  • Meticulous use of Salesforce CRM to track activities, opportunities, etc.
  • Adaptable, and comfortable with change

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Restricted stock units
  • Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, & retirement savings plan
  • Flexible time off / holidays
  • Mentorship opportunities

 

A reasonable estimate of the current range is 80k-$95K, plus commission/bonus. This compensation range considers the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill set, experience, training, licensure, certifications, geography and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled.

 

Digimarc is seeking diverse applicants. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected factor. We want the best people who share our values.


This job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

 

Principals only. No recruiters please.

results.title: Global Support Manager
results.description:
Based on your experience and pragmatism, you will be razor focused on efficiently delivering success to our ever growing customer base with a highly motivated team.

You work closely together with the Global direct Customer Operations, Global Manager Process Manager and Global Manager Professional Services, your own support team (Regional Managers & Teamlead) and internal operational departments (Cloud, Product and Development).

You are Globally responsible for the quality of support to our partners and direct customers. You are capable of working according the ITIL Service Framework and reflect this back to the operational departments.



Some job responsibilities:
1. Bring the Support organization to the next level, mainly focused on supporting our ever expanding Fortune 500 customer base

2. Drive effective automation, efficient team collaboration and knowledge sharing

3. Align and improve 24x7 & follow-the-sun

4. Improve team productivity by increasing competency and continuous ‘improvement mindset’

5. Lead and resolve escalations where needed and actively coach Regional Support Managers to prevent escalations

6. Ensure efficient collaboration and alignment between the various operations and services teams of the broader Anywhere365 Group

7. Develop and execute mid/long term strategy in line with company leadership vision and mission (managing en implementation of Continuous Improvement Plan Support)

8. Contact with our most important partners at C level, through participation in strategic meetings

9. Managing and reporting Support KPI’s (SLA, CTBA, #Tickets)

 

-> please note: we are specifically looking for European-based candidates for this role!

 

We pick character over skills, can you convince us that you are:

1. Aware of what it's like to work for a rapidly growing company and comfortable to work under pressure with strict deadlinest

2. Flexible, polite and empathetic towards customers and co-workers

3. Autonomous, helpful and a mentor towards your co-workers

4. Accurate, analytical and curious

5. A team player, bringing people together around common goals

6. Takes ownership

7. Peoplemanager, coaches and guides team of employees

 

Did we just picture your time travelling destination and does it sound like a reflection of yourself? Quite possibly we’re heading in the same direction! Check out the details below to verify if these summarize your profile furthermore:

 

Let's face it, you need to have some skills to make the mission possible

How many of these boxes can you check?

  • Proactively working on continuous improvement of support
  • You have an eagle eye view on the entire quality of support within Anywhere365
  • Expert in ITIL process management
  • Proven experience in identifying and defining global uniform processes
  • Have experience beyond the process, think in solutions that bridge departments and services
  • How to implement professionalizing changes within a fast growing company
  • Reading, speaking and writing in English

 

This is us:

Did we already mention that Anywhere365 is a successful, rapidly expanding international scale-up? Well, we are. And so, we have a headquarter office that will give you goose bumps. As we should. But since remote working is the current standard, and we hate cheap stuff that doesn’t go the extra mile, we provide any great hardware and software that you need to connect with customers, partners and co-workers.

Anywhere365 is highly ambitious, which reflects in our tech stack and architecture as well as our culture and people’s DNA. Together we build strong connections and achieve great results. We love to celebrate our successes and look forward to celebrate yours soon!

 

Now, the million-dollar question:

No, you’re not going to make millions a year. Yet. But working within Anywhere365 will substantially add value to your work experience (and your chance to become a millionaire once). We do pay well. Not just your monthly wage, but also pension insurance, reimbursement of work-related costs, high end equipment and enough holidays to balance your job with your private life. Last but not least, you'll work with down-to-earth, smart, driven, engaged and ambitious co-workers that practically always go the extra mile.

So....are you ready to become our next Tech Time Traveler? We'd love to meet you soon!

 

Agencies are requested not to respond to this vacancy!

results.description:

results.title: Operations Associate
results.description:
At Convergent Research we launch large-scale, high-impact science projects. We aim to help fill a structural gap in today's R&D system. We enable fundamental research that requires unusual levels of scale and coordination yet is not rapidly monetizable by industry. We’re bringing together top talent from academia, industry, and startups to build a new model for innovative R&D. As an incubator within the Schmidt Futures Network, we identify high-impact scientific or technical research and development opportunities, ultimately defining and launching these projects as Focused Research Organizations.
 
The operations associate will support the administration and daily operational activities for the Convergent Research team. We are looking for a reliable, organized, and enthusiastic admin who can work in a fast paced environment to help the team run smoothly and efficiently. 



You are:
  • Team player. You are an active listener and great communicator who is flexible and happy to help your teammates at any opportunity!
  • Highly organized and good with data. You can prioritize tasks and create Excel spreadsheets and documents with all of the information you’ve collected in a timely manner. 
  • Detail oriented. You notice the little things. When something is missing, out of place, or wrong, you make sure it gets addressed before it becomes a problem.
  • Solution oriented. When you identify an issue - a process isn’t working or something is amiss, you come prepared with possible solutions to fix it.
  • Eager to learn. You are open-minded, curious, and enjoy learning new things and new tools! You are the first to volunteer to take on new challenges!
  • Tech-savvy. A new project management system is implemented throughout the organization? No problem, you are an early adopter of anything tech. You are a pro (or can easily become a pro) with tools such as Notion, Slack, and Lever.
  • A great juggler. Startups move at a fast-pace and you are able to change priorities and handle multiple tasks at once without blinking. Actual juggling is always a plus.



You will:
  • Support vendor onboarding, collect forms, and documents, make phone calls, send out emails and follow up with internal and external stakeholders. 
  • Review invoices to ensure accuracy and categorize them in the correct class and accounts.
  • Assist with recruiting, updating job descriptions, posting on job boards, and scheduling interviews.
  • Prepare and submit expense reports and associated documentation on time each month.
  • Manage calendars and light travel.
  • Be a keen observer of our internal processes, enthusiastically seek new ways to contribute operationally and suggest improvements to our existing processes.



In three months, you will:
  • Take primary responsibility for onboarding new vendors on a weekly basis. You’ll collect W-9 forms, New Vendor Forms, and Bank Verification Letters to submit to billing. Complete and return credit check information and get ACH bank information as necessary. 
  • Learn how to review invoices to categorize them into classes and accounts.
  • Become the primary point of contact of scheduling interviews and managing our applicant tracking system.
  • Become one of the individuals your colleagues come to with questions on our operational processes because you have demonstrated your adaptability and quick collection of know-how.



We offer:
  • An opportunity to change the world and work with some of the smartest and the most talented experts from different fields.
  • Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance through a PPO plan; parental leave.
  • Generous time off + paid holidays.
  • Wellness allowance for fitness and wellness activities.
  • Support for fully remote work.
  • Frequent opportunities to spend time with colleagues in person.
 
 
Convergent Research aims to help fill a structural gap in today's R&D system. We enable fundamental research that requires unusual levels of scale and coordination yet is not rapidly monetizable by industry. We’re bringing together top talent from academia, industry, and startups to build a new model for innovative R&D. As an incubator within the Schmidt Futures Network, we identify high-impact scientific or technical research and development opportunities, ultimately defining and launching these projects as Focused Research Organizations.
 
Convergent Research, LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. We do not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. We strive for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibit harassment of any kind.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Who we are:
Bixal is a mission-driven, woman-owned small business determined to improve people's lives through human-centered strategies and transformative technologies, with a firm belief that everyone has the right to an effective government.  
 
We deliver on this belief by partnering with leading Federal agencies to design, develop, and deliver powerful customer experiences through holistic digital product solutions and strategic communications initiatives––bringing a high standard and unique creative energy to our clients––and our wonderfully diverse culture is what makes it all possible.  
 
Bixal unites different people with different perspectives from all over the world! We provide our team with an open and empowered environment where collaboration thrives and solutions flourish. 
 
Location:
This role can work remotely from anywhere in the USA. You must be legally authorized to work in the US.  Bixal does not provide visa sponsorship.  
 
What will you do?
Bixal is looking for mission-driven, forward-thinking technologists and communicators interested in helping improve the customer experience around government services. As the Product Manager, you will lead a cross-functional digital product team, establishing and aligning work streams around a product vision based on research and data. Further, you will act as an advocate for the client/Product Owner, ensuring that the product solves for user needs and achieves business objectives.
 
The ideal candidate is a curious and independent problem solver who can design and deliver products with a positive attitude, and who has experience in a client-facing role.
 



Responsibilities:
  • Act as the product champion.  
  • Evangelize customer needs and product concepts internally and externally to obtain buy-in and drive adoption.  
  • Develop a deep understanding of target customer needs and apply it to defining, designing, building and launching products.  
  • Evaluate complex product ideas or requests and effectively elicit product requirements, articulating a rationale for those that are worth pursuing.  
  • Translate goals and objectives into outputs or user stories for the Bixal product team to implement.  
  • Lead collaboration with the team and stakeholders using “design thinking” to identify corrective and beneficial product direction and take the initiative to see these through.  
  • Prioritize functionality on a product roadmap.  
  • Lead product-related communications with client stakeholders and the Bixal internal team.  
  • Prioritize the product backlog to ensure goals and objectives of the client/Product Owner(s) are achieved.    
  • Orchestrate the activities of a cross-functional team to ensure that workstream outputs complement each other and remain oriented toward solving identified user needs.  
  • Confidently curate and present information in front of Product Owners, client stakeholders, or Bixal leadership as requested.   
  • Establish, measure, and report on product success metrics.
  • Create, review and approve written, graphic and summary documents and presentations for internal and external use in communicating product goals and objectives.    
  • Participate in meetings and/or demonstrations with client POCs as needed.  
  • Perform other duties or special projects as assigned.   



Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree required.  
  • Ability to undergo and obtain a Public Trust security clearance.   
  • 5+ years of total professional experience. 
  • 3+ years of experience managing cross-functional product teams in positions of increasing complexity and responsibility.    
  • Demonstrated ability to navigate uncertainty and define product expectations in an environment where product concepts are not well understood.  
  • Ability to understand technical challenges and make educated trade-offs with the team and stakeholders.   
  • Ability to communicate the functional capabilities of websites and applications in layman's terms with business and technical stakeholders.   
  • Ability to advocate for prioritized product outcomes against clearly defined goals.  
  • Exceptional management and leadership skills.  
  • Excellent soft skills: good communicator, emotionally intelligent, empathetic, good follow-up, polite, positive attitude.  
  • Proven track record of managing issues and risk through mitigation strategies.  
  • Demonstrated history of interfacing with internal project teams and senior management, as well as external clients and other stakeholders.   
  • Experience in human-centered design principles and adoption of Agile mindset.  
  • Strong written and oral communications skills.  
  • Sharp attention to detail and excellent organization skills.   
  • Strong experience and comfortability with Microsoft Office suite, Keynote, and virtual collaboration tools such as Miro.   



Nice to Haves:
  • Certified Product Manager (CPM) or equivalent product management certification.    
  • Background in or experience with design thinking processes and tools.  
  • Experience with the USDS Playbook and U.S. Web Design System.  
  • Experience with Drupal and JIRA.   
  • Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management platforms.
  • People management/supervisory experience preferred.  
Perks & Benefits:
Competitive base salary
Flex hours
Work from home flexibility
401K with matching incentive
Parental Leave
Medical/dental/vision benefits
Flex Spending Account
Company provided short-term disability
Company provided life insurance
Commuter benefits
Generous PTO
11 Paid holidays
Professional development opportunities
New business referral bonus

It ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
About NoRedInk
It has never been more important that students around the world have the tools and support to learn through digital instruction. NoRedInk helps students become better writers in more than 60% of middle and high schools in the U.S. Our adaptive curriculum engages learners by personalizing exercises to their interests, guiding them step-by-step through the writing process, and boosting their skills through differentiated practice. We’re relentlessly focused on helping all students harness the power of the written word.
 
About the Role
NoRedInk is looking for a product designer to help us achieve our mission of unlocking every writer’s potential. In this role, you’ll serve as the dedicated designer for two of our cross-functional feature teams: 1) Product Growth and 2) Learning Experience. Every feature team at NoRedInk owns a significant aspect of our strategy and product, and you’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, curriculum specialists, and other key stakeholders to build innovative software solutions that improve the lives of our users.
 
More specifically, the product designer is responsible for owning the end-to-end design strategy and solutions for each of their product areas by using design thinking, creative problem solving, and visual design craft to deliver meaningful experiences for our students, teachers, and administrators. All of our product designers are “generalists,” meaning that they drive research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, prototyping, and everything in between.
 
Design at NoRedInk sits within the larger product team, consisting of product managers and product designers. The design team itself is small but mighty, currently consisting of two other product designers.  As the third member of this team, you’ll be a partner in up-leveling the role of design at NoRedInk by assuming the highest level of ownership over our design system, direction, and processes.
 
In this role, you will:
  • Own end-to-end design for two product areas: Product Growth and Learning Experience.
  • Drive research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, prototyping, and usability testing for new features and experiments.
  • Partner with product managers, engineers, curriculum specialists, and stakeholders from other departments to define, design, and build features that delight users
  • Drive improvements to our product’s overall design, tooling, and processes, and contribute to maintaining and growing our design system
 
About You:
  • 7+ years relevant experience on an in-house product design team 
  • Experience driving end-to-end design for critical, complex projects that both solve user needs and achieve business outcomes
  • Strong across information architecture, interaction design, visual design, and prototyping
  • Experience working on an agile team with product managers and engineers
  • Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills
  • Ability to independently manage deliverables and set expectations with clear communication, planning, and estimated timelines
  • Excellent at giving and receiving design feedback 
  • Passion for K-12 education and a deep commitment to improving outcomes for students and educators
 
What NoRedInk Offers:
  • A competitive salary and equity package in a high-growth, well-funded startup with massive traction
  • Excellent health, vision, and dental benefits (U.S. Only)
  • A remote-first culture that allows for flexible hours (We were big on remote before COVID!)
  • A relaxed and flexible PTO policy and paid parental leave
  • 401(k) (U.S. Only)
  • LinkedIn Learning subscription with unlimited access to thousands of expert-led online courses
  • Team retreats and events to connect with fun, talented coworkers
  • Consistent modeling of our company’s core values
  • The ability to help millions of students and teachers and address a critical societal need
 
About NoRedInk:
NoRedInk helps students in over 60% of US school districts become better writers. Our deeply engaging, adaptive curriculum personalizes exercises to kids' interests, guides them through the writing process with instructional support, and boosts their skills through targeted practice. Students have completed over 10 billion exercises on our site, and our mission is to help all students harness the power of the written word.
 
Check out our press page, including our 2-minute pitch on NBC and articles in The Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, and Forbes.
 
NoRedInk believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. At NoRedInk, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. 
 
Compensation at NoRedInk is robust and includes a full range of benefits, unlimited PTO, monthly co-working stipends, an initial home-office set up stipend, and generous equity. Our salary ranges are based on location specific market data and internal parity. For New York City, the salary range for this role is $160,000.00 - $175,000.00. Please know that if you are invited to speak with a recruiter at NoRedInk, they will have an open discussion about compensation during your first call to ensure alignment. 
 
*Note: Agencies or other third-party recruiters may not submit unsolicited candidate resumes or their information to any NoRedInk employee, including a NoRedInk Recruiter, unless a contract is signed and you are given permission by the Talent Acquisition team to work on a job opening.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Userpilot is a leading product engagement and analytics software that is used by 700+ companies worldwide. Our pioneering event-based tracking solution gives product teams the ability to gain insights into how to best acquire, convert, and retain their users with the additional help of user engagement and feedback tools.

Userpilot is looking for a Senior Product Designer as follows:

Responsibilities

  • Work with product leadership to craft, refine, implement, and communicate design vision and strategy across the organization.
  • Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.
  • Collaborate closely with product, business, and engineering partners in an agile environment.
  • Create prototypes for new product ideas & test these ideas before implementing.
  • Effectively communicate and evangelize design thinking throughout the organization with compelling storytelling.
  • Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyze and predict user behavior.
  • Deliver innovative design experiences to our customers at each stage of their journey.
  • Ensure the delivery of a consistent user experience across the product

Requirements

  • You have at least 3 years of design experience.
  • You have an online portfolio of professional UI/UX design work showcasing an appetite for designs that push boundaries and take risks.
  • You find and craft elegant but practical solutions to design challenges.
  • You're proficient in design and prototyping software such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite, or Invision.
  • You’re energized by hands-on work: sketching concepts, defining flows, building prototypes, or polishing final designs.
  • You have previous experience working with Product Management and Engineering teams.
  • You have a broad range of skills with strengths in visual product design.
  • You’re constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback, user research, contextual interviews, and competitive/analogous research.
  • You’re proactive, creative, adaptable, and collaborative. You love wrestling with problems.
  • You quickly create a range of engaging, elegant, easy-to-use, and technically-feasible ideas.
